newsitem.title: USA: Cobra sees growth in CB radio sales.
newsitem.headline: Cobra sees growth in CB radio sales.

text.p: Cobra Electronics Corp said Tuesday it expects its U.S. citizen band (CB) radio sales to post double-digit growth in 1997, following the release of models with a patent-pending noise reduction system.

Cobra said it has begun shipping two models of its CB radios with SoundTracker noise reduction systems, which reduce static and allow users' voices to break through cluttered airwaves. The company said orders have been very strong for the technology.

"We expect the strong acceptance of this new technology to translate into significantly higher CB sales and increased market share for Cobra in 1997," Jerry Kalov, president and chief executive, said in a statement. "We expect SoundTracker technology to accelerate the replacement of older CBs by users who want this new technology and, as a result, are projecting a double-digit increase in our domestic CB business for 1997."
Kalov said Cobra's domestic CB sales posted single-digit growth in both 1996 and 1995.
Cobra reported 1996 overall sales of $90.32 million versus $90.44 million in 1995.
Cobra Electronics provides consumer electronics products.
